title: Red Pepper Soup
introduction: The vibrant red-orange color of Red Pepper Soup is an appealing and flavorful delight, inspired by a soup from a popular trattoria in Florence. Its refreshing flavor pairs beautifully with warm focaccia.
ingredients: 6 cups homemade Chicken Broth or a mix of half store-bought broth and half water
5 large red bell peppers, seeded and chopped
5 medium boiling potatoes, peeled and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Prepare the broth, if necessary. Then, pour the oil into a large pot. Add the onion, celery, and carrot. Cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat until the vegetables are tender and golden, about 10 minutes.
Add the peppers, potatoes, and tomatoes and stir well. Add the broth and bring to a simmer. Lower the heat and cook 30 minutes or until the vegetables are very tender.
With a slotted spoon, transfer the vegetables to a food processor or blender. Puree until smooth.
Pour the vegetable puree into the pot. Heat the soup gently and stir in the milk. Do not allow the soup to boil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, sprinkled with cheese.
